chapter.title: Review of guiding questions
chapter.content:
Throughout this lesson, we've explored four guiding questions related to issues surrounding ELLs.

Specifically, we:

  • uncovered the prevalence of ELLs
  • looked at the difficulties associated with screening and testing ELLs for LD and
  • discussed the different items to be considered when exploring the option of testing ELLs for LD; and
  • reviewed instructional strategies and accommodations for teaching ELLs with possible or identified LD.

chapter.title: Activity: Share your thoughts
chapter.content:
Take some time to reflect on the concepts and ideas presented in Learning Disabilities and English Language Learners and your plans for acting on this information by answering the following questions:

  • Of all the concepts and ideas discussed in this course:
    • Which were new to you?
    • Which ideas stood out as most important for you and your practice in supporting adult ELLs with LD in your classroom?
    • What are some specific strategies from this course that you feel you can readily incorporate to help your adult ELL students with LD?

  • What other strategies or LD screening tools have you used, and how effective were they?

Please share the specific strategies and tools you plan to incorporate into your practice in the LINCS Disabilities in Adult Education Group before moving on.
